intro: Hemionitis chrysophylla, commonly known as the golden fern, is a rare and delicate plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Hemionitidaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, bright yellow foliage. The plant is often found in shaded, moist environments, typically growing in rocky or forested areas. Its unique appearance and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered vulnerable and requires careful preservation.
